master

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • master.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Navigation handles all movement of the Robot's wheel motors. No class can move the robot unless it access the methods through the nav class.
    Since:
    2016-11-29
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jerome Marfleet, Yu-Yueh Liu

      • driveDistanceForward

        public void driveDistanceForward(double distance,
                        boolean letAlert)
        Drive forward for a certain distance
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance to move forward
        letAlert - Boolean to stop the motors: True when obstacle is seen, False otherwise

        y - - desired y position

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Rotates the robot about a given angle, theta
        Parameters:
        theta - - angle of turn

      • getAngle

        public int getAngle(double x1,
           double y1,
           double x2,
           double y2,
           int orientation)
        getAngle takes in the current x-y position and orientation of the robot, and the x-y position of a desired destination. The method returns the minimum turning angle required for the robot to face the new position
        Parameters:
        x1 - - Initial x position
        y1 - - Initial y position
        x2 - - Final x position
        y2 - - Final y position
        orientation - - current angle of the robot
        Returns:
        integer of the angle needed to rotate in order to face new position
